articles.title: Jackson Holliday, son of seven-time All-Star Matt Holliday, selected by Baltimore Orioles with No. 1 overall pick in MLB draft
articles.description: Shortstop Jackson Holliday, the son of seven-time All-Star Matt Holliday, was selected by the Baltimore Orioles as the No. 1 overall pick in baseball's draft on Sunday in Los Angeles.
articles.content:
LOS ANGELES -- Jackson Holliday, the son of seven-time All-Star Matt Holliday, was selected by the Baltimore Orioles as the No. 1 overall pick in baseball's draft on Sunday.

articles.title: Superstar rookie Julio Rodriguez's key hit powers Seattle Mariners' 14th straight win
articles.description: The Mariners are just one game shy of tying their team record of 15 consecutive wins, set during their most recent playoff season in 2001.
articles.content: ARLINGTON, Texas -- The Seattle Mariners won their 14th straight game as rookie All-Star Julio Rodriguez hit a two-run double and Ty France homered after joining him on the American League team to be… [+2420 chars]

articles.title: USMNT's Matt Turner denies Arsenal puts international status at risk

articles.content:

articles.title: Portland Trail Blazers recover from slow start to beat New York Knicks for second NBA Summer League title since 2017
articles.description: The Trail Blazers got 36 points from their reserves and beat the Knicks 85-77 on Sunday for their second NBA Summer League title since 2017. Trendon Watford had 19 points and seven rebounds en route to earning game MVP honors.
articles.content:
LAS VEGAS -- Brandon Williams scored 22 points to lead the Portland Trail Blazers to an 85-77 victory over the New York Knicks in the NBA summer league championship on Sunday.

articles.title: Florida Gators QB Anthony Richardson distancing from 'AR-15' nickname, branding
articles.description: Gators quarterback Anthony Richardson, who wears No. 15, will no longer use the nickname "AR-15" as part of his personal brand in an effort to not be associated with the assault rifle.

articles.title: Boston Red Sox's Chris Sale exits in first inning after comebacker hits throwing hand
articles.description: Red Sox left-hander Chris Sale injured his throwing hand when he was struck by a comebacker during the first inning of Sunday's game against the Yankees.
articles.content:
Boston Red Sox left-hander Chris Sale injured his throwing hand when he was struck by a comebacker during the first inning of Sunday's game against the New York Yankees.

articles.description: Justin Jefferson praised Davante Adams as the NFL's best wide receiver during a recent interview with Complex but added that he's "pretty sure after this year, it's going to be me."

articles.author: Zach LoweESPN Senior Writer
articles.title: Lowe - Why Kevin Durant and Donovan Mitchell megadeals could expand an unprecedented NBA trend
articles.description: Over the past decade, there have been seven trades in which one team sends three or more of its future first-round picks. Two more such deals, for KD and Mitchell, could happen soon. The risks are massive. So what is driving teams to make these moves?
